newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Inter Delta denies acquisition talk.
newsitem.headline: Inter Delta denies acquisition talk.

text.p: Indonesia film and photographic equipment manufacturer PT Inter Delta on Monday denied speculation that it could be the target of a takeover bid.

Company finance manager Rudi Widjaja said a sharp rise in Inter Delta's share prices could be due to some shareholders diluting their stakes but added there was no truth in rumours that the company was likely to be acquired.
Inter Delta prices rose 3.88 percent, or 125 rupiah, to 3,350 rupiah on a volume of 1.2 million shares in morning trading on Monday.
On Friday, it rose 175 rph to 3,225 on a volume of 1.5 million shares.
"It is purely market speculation. We have no intention to tie-up with any other company. neither are we going to be taken over," Widjaja told Reuters.
He however added that PT Nagraya Wahana, which owned 2.15 million shares in Inter Delta, or about 14.3 percent of the company, had sold two million shares in August.
Widjaja also said that PT Putra Enseval Mega Trading, which held a 30 percent stake in Inter Delata, had sold a small part of its holding.
He did not identify the buyers but said further sales were unlikely.
